name: Steamed Alaskan King Crab Claws
headline: Steamed Alaskan King Crab Claws
keywords: Easy Main Dish,Main Dish,American,Crab Recipes,Shellfish Recipes,Microwave Recipes,Gluten Free,Low-Carb,Low-Fat

recipeInstructions.text: If necessary in order to fit in microwave, cut claws at joints. Wrap 3 claws at a time in a damp paper towel, along with 1 sprig of dill, and then wrap in plastic wrap. Place wrapped claws in microwave 1 package at a time and cook on high for 2 minutes. Remove and unwrap carefully. Serve immediately.

review.reviewBody:
Probably all microwaves have their own personality. Made good fat snowcrab. From frozen put on 2 min, then had to add another 2, and then they were spotty, warm and cold, so had to add another minute.
Maybe my fault, as if 2 min is for one set of 3 legs, then I needed more time as I had for paper tolled legs.
On another note, curious if anyone knows. Our crab legs came out very salty, and we did not add any. Could that be a result of microwave cooking, or it has nothing to do with the microwave?
Awesome!!!

Perfect - so simple & delicious. Didn't have dill - but method was perfect. My first small batch of crab - I steamed (5 min, gentle steam) .. decided to cook the rest of the crab I had - microwaved & was even better than the steamed - fabulous
This worked perfectly!
The best!  Easy and affordable if you find them on sale.  I did not use Dill and still delish.  Make sure to not buy Alaskan Crab Legs from Russia (read the label) as they are way too salty!

I had friends over for a Good Friday dinner and fixed the crab legs the way your recipe says to do, except I used the new steam bags from J&J worked perfectly. Everyone raved about how great they tasted , much better than at a restaurant.
Thank you made me looked liked I knew how to cook.

So easy. I have fixed them using this method for the last year. Thanks, Alton. While picking out some legs yesterday, a woman asked how I fix them. As I told her the 'process' I gained the attention of 5-6 folks. There were skeptics about using the plastic wrap etc…but who cares it works. Drawn butter, wedge salad, a nice white wine and I'm set.

Simple. Easy. Delicious. Perfection!!!  Thank you Alton, I used to boil my crab legs... wasted energy and flavor.  The only thing this recipe needs is a good wine, some warm drawn butter, a good friend to get messy with.... oh, and a wet cloth to clean up after the deliciousness!
This is my first time I've ever felt the need to review anything on this website.THIS RECIPE IS AMAZING!!!!!! I never even made crab legs before but now ill be doing it frequently! Thanks!

I have been drooling over the commercials on TV for a certain chain restaurant. They are having their crab promotion this month . Then I saw your show about steaming crab legs in the microwave ..... here's where your genius come in....your simple instructions involve just popping the crab in microwave, 2 minutes, then, Viola, juicy, sweet crab. So I thought I can do this and bought the biggest King Crab legs I could find and mentally challenged you and was up for the challenge.
WOW! Sweet, juicy, the best I ever ate crab legs and I fixed them with the sprig of dill (who would have thought!)
and clarified some butter, had mayo with Old Bay seasoning and was armed with my claw clippers and kept thinking that was the easiest meal I have ever done and now I am a GENIUS to, thanks to you.

I had purchased crab legs just hours before I saw your show.  My plans were to boil them.  OOH BABY!! My crabs were extra delicious prepared your way.  I am a diabetic and now I have a new healthy tasty meal to add to my options.  Thanks Alton:)
My mom uses the paper towel method all the time when she pops something in the microwave.  Who knew Alton Brown would use it also? Absolutely brilliant.

This method of steaming crab claws is perfect.  I would have never thought to do it this way until seeing it on TV.  With that being said, I figured that I should try this in a microwaveable steam bag and the results were just as great.  Just pop the claws or legs in the bag, add some butter/margarine, parsley/dill, Old Bay seasoning (if you like) and cook for a few minutes.  I see now that crabs that are boiled/steamed in the pot are bland and tasteless.  But with this method, not only is the crab flavorful and moist but the clean-up is even easier because you just toss the bag after you're done!!
The most tasty & tender crab legs I've ever made. Almost didn't include the fresh dill - that would have been a big mistake, it was a perfect complementary flavor to the crab legs.

I was soooo intimidated buying and cooking anything like this, even though I LOVE seafood. Thank you so much for teaching me how to enjoy this at home at a fraction of the price. I'm going to venture out and try some other receipes! I feel so empowered!!!LOL!
Super easy and perfect!

This recipe saved Mother's Day!  We had never cooked King Crab legs before, and my mom requested them for Mother's day.  I was afraid of ruining this expensive treat, so I did some research and found Alton's recipe.  It was easy and the crab legs came out perfect!! Trust the 2 min time.  Another bonus, we took each packet and before it was opened, used a hammer to crack the legs with no mess.  Thank you Alton for saving Mother's day!

Alton has done it again! I must admit the cooking time scared me. 2 minutes, that seemed way to short. So I ended up cooking them for 2 and half minutes. RESIST the temptation, they were slightly over done. Be sure to serve them as soon as possible as well. Don't let them sit in there packages for to long. But still 5 stars for this wonderful recipe!!
Alton, you rule!!  This method of steaming kept all of the crabs flavor contained.  Awesome!!
loved loved loved...the whole thing....loved it

Could not be any easier or more delicious!  Just made for anniversay and they were a hit.  Used Emeril's clarified butter recipe, as it called for less butter and was several steps shorter, also a huge hit.
We tried this recipe tonight, and I have never had such perfectly prepared crab. Ever!

I never would have thought about using the microwave for crab legs but once we tried them I will never do them any other way.  It makes total sense and it was amazing. We could eat a small batch at a time so they would not get cold and onlyhad to wait two minutes for another hot batch.  Thank you Alton you are truly a culinary genius.

I agree that it seems unconventional to use a microwave especially with seafood but this was a lot faster than boiling/steaming and a lot less messy. The crab came out very juicey and was cooked perfectly.
so quick and easy..little clean up!!!moist and delicious...not overcooked.
Excellent method of preparation. Simple and quick. Crab legs were tender and delicious without being soggy. And no pots to clean!!! Thanks, Alton.
This was as good as you can get and so easy.  Fantastic.
I bought jumbo King Crab legs and followed these instructions...I can't believe it was so easy and delicious!
I thought this dish was amazing !
We typically grille our crab legs and baste them with butter while they are cooking. It was too cold for that today so we tried the microwave.  They turned out great and it was sooo easy.
The quickest and easiest recipe I ever had to do. Everyone was amazed!
My family watched the episode and had to try the crab.  It was beyond simple and satisfying.  The dill did not take away from the flavor of the crab.

For Father's Day we used this recipe to cook our crab legs. It was for a group of 12, and every one of them is a crab lef fanatic - and very doubtful of our recipe for cooking them in the microwave. Well - we couldn't even get the crab legs to the table - every batch that came out was devoured immediately! They were fantastic, the taste was unbelievable, and everyone was very impressed at how good they were. I will never cook them any other way!

My first-grader loves crab legs, but they were a special treat saved for restaurant dining.  That is, until he saw your show.  I could no longer claim ignorance after we watched you prepare these.  Now the child watches the sales ads and hounds me whenever crab legs are on sale and will actually plaster himself against the seafood case until I relent.  You are turning my child into a food snob.  First your chewy chocolate chip cookies, now the crab legs.  Still, we love you!!

I've made this recipe, or my own altered version of it, twice now and the crab turns out perfect without a mess!  I didn't have fresh dill so I sprinkled the damp paper towel liberally with dried dill.  The dill flavor is very mild, but the crab turned out perfect.  Thank you!
Easy! Simple! Delicious, not dry.

Trust the microwave timing on this one and it will turn out perfect!  I was sceptical about the ghee and so was my husband until we tried it.  There's no going back to melted old butter now!  It's adds so much flavor, and we had an amazing meal.
Delicious & easy - what more could you want?  I think this was the quickest dinner I've ever prepared and my 3-year-old even gobbled them up.
By far the simplest and most delectible!!  Love the Altom!!!!
I love this show!  Alton is the best and so were the crab legs I cooked!  The best I ever had, really!  I cannot believe the method he provided works but it does!
Wow, I never knew something so good could be so easy.

I did this with the entire crab claw & leg.  I'm at 9,000 feet altitude, so I cooked each 3 minutes.  The crab was fantastic.  The ghee recipe is also simple and much better than just plain ol' melted butter.

This is the easiest and best way to do your crab legs. I'm a crab lover and love to serve my friends freshly steamed crab with dill, now from my microwave!

Thanks Alton.
Great way to cook crab legs.  Now, it makes this meal an easier option when perusing the seafood aisle!
One of my favorite meals is suddenly within my reach. I didn't realize how easy it was to make king crab legs. Follow the directions and you are home.

I'm a die-hard crab lover and mother of 22-month-old triplets.  It's SO good to have a way of cooking up a real mommy treat in the mere seconds I occassionally have available for such luxuries.  The crab comes out beautifully -- never dried out, always tender and yummy!  Of course, I can't resist adding just a bit of garlic butter for dipping.  Some habits are best left unbroken...  I love you, Alton!
I have cooked crab several different ways. Some simple and some far from it.  This is the best tasting easiest recipe I have found.  Absolutely Great!
Absolutely the only way to prepare crab legs! Easy and de-licious!
It doesn't get any easier than this.  The best tasting crab legs I've ever had. I tried the Ghee and simple melted butter and the Ghee was better.

This crab was the best crab I have ever tasted, I love, love, loved it. I am going to make crab alot more! And I dont know if it is just me but, i think food tastes the best when you cook it yourself, and after you are done cooking it and you are sitting down at your table eating what you have just made, you feel so good, it crosses your mind and you are like " Wow! I just made CRAB!! "

Even a two year old can make this recipe.  It's easy and totally Good Eats!  We made it for my mother in law and also made the ghee for dipping.  Never had such tender crab before, and easy to remove from the shell.  Thanks, Alton!
